  4. Trend Analysis

Note

Go to the end to download the full example code.

Trend AnalysisÂ¶

Detecting and visualizing trends in time series data.

import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import dartwork_mpl as dm

dm.style.use_preset('scientific')

# Generate time series with different trends
np.random.seed(42)
n = 100
t = np.arange(n)

# Linear trend
linear_trend = 20 + 0.5*t + np.random.randn(n)*2

# Quadratic trend
quad_trend = 10 + 0.1*t + 0.01*t**2 + np.random.randn(n)*3

# Seasonal + trend
seasonal_trend = 30 + 0.3*t + 8*np.sin(2*np.pi*t/20) + np.random.randn(n)*2

# Changepoint
change_trend = np.concatenate([30 + 0.2*t[:50], 40 + 0.8*t[50:]]) + np.random.randn(n)*2

fig = plt.figure(figsize=(dm.cm2in(17), dm.cm2in(10)), dpi=200)
gs = fig.add_gridspec(nrows=2, ncols=2, left=0.08, right=0.98,
                      top=0.95, bottom=0.08, wspace=0.3, hspace=0.4)

# Panel A: Linear trend
ax1 = fig.add_subplot(gs[0, 0])
ax1.scatter(t, linear_trend, c='dm.blue5', s=5, alpha=0.6, label='Data')
z = np.polyfit(t, linear_trend, 1)
p = np.poly1d(z)
ax1.plot(t, p(t), color='dm.red5', lw=0.7, label='Linear fit')
ax1.set_xlabel('Time', fontsize=dm.fs(0))
ax1.set_ylabel('Value', fontsize=dm.fs(0))
ax1.set_title('Linear Trend', fontsize=dm.fs(1))
ax1.legend(loc='upper left', fontsize=dm.fs(-1))

# Panel B: Polynomial trend
ax2 = fig.add_subplot(gs[0, 1])
ax2.scatter(t, quad_trend, c='dm.green5', s=5, alpha=0.6, label='Data')
z2 = np.polyfit(t, quad_trend, 2)
p2 = np.poly1d(z2)
ax2.plot(t, p2(t), color='dm.red5', lw=0.7, label='Quadratic fit')
ax2.set_xlabel('Time', fontsize=dm.fs(0))
ax2.set_ylabel('Value', fontsize=dm.fs(0))
ax2.set_title('Polynomial Trend', fontsize=dm.fs(1))
ax2.legend(loc='upper left', fontsize=dm.fs(-1))

# Panel C: Detrending
ax3 = fig.add_subplot(gs[1, 0])
z3 = np.polyfit(t, seasonal_trend, 1)
p3 = np.poly1d(z3)
detrended = seasonal_trend - p3(t)
ax3.plot(t, seasonal_trend, color='dm.gray5', lw=0.5, alpha=0.5, label='Original')
ax3.plot(t, detrended, color='dm.violet5', lw=0.7, label='Detrended')
ax3.axhline(y=0, color='k', lw=0.3, linestyle='--')
ax3.set_xlabel('Time', fontsize=dm.fs(0))
ax3.set_ylabel('Value', fontsize=dm.fs(0))
ax3.set_title('Detrending', fontsize=dm.fs(1))
ax3.legend(loc='upper right', fontsize=dm.fs(-1))

# Panel D: Changepoint detection
ax4 = fig.add_subplot(gs[1, 1])
ax4.scatter(t, change_trend, c='dm.orange5', s=5, alpha=0.6)
# Fit two segments
z4a = np.polyfit(t[:50], change_trend[:50], 1)
z4b = np.polyfit(t[50:], change_trend[50:], 1)
p4a = np.poly1d(z4a)
p4b = np.poly1d(z4b)
ax4.plot(t[:50], p4a(t[:50]), color='dm.red5', lw=0.7)
ax4.plot(t[50:], p4b(t[50:]), color='dm.red5', lw=0.7)
ax4.axvline(x=50, color='dm.blue5', lw=0.5, linestyle='--', label='Changepoint')
ax4.set_xlabel('Time', fontsize=dm.fs(0))
ax4.set_ylabel('Value', fontsize=dm.fs(0))
ax4.set_title('Changepoint Detection', fontsize=dm.fs(1))
ax4.legend(loc='upper left', fontsize=dm.fs(-1))

dm.simple_layout(fig, gs=gs)
plt.show()

Total running time of the script: (0 minutes 0.997 seconds)
